intro: Notothixos philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a compact cluster. Notothixos philippinensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological role in its native environment.
